Body: Description: The server version is 5.9.4.1 but it isn't an option. I am seeing a "Your appliance is running low on disk space, there is 6.61 gb free available from 19.52 gb (34%). EPP Server functionality and performance may be severely affected. Use Audit Log Backup to reduce the logs stored in the database, delete older system and audit log backups, and tune policies to reduce incoming log count. For further assistance contact Support." message in our EPP console. I've deleted many old backups but I still see the message. Not sure if this is a part of the issue, but I can't do any client software upgrades through the console either.

What We've Learned Updated: The php log file from the system partition is writing logs constantly which causes the disk space to fill up slowly.
usr/local/logs/php-fpm.log

What We've Learned Updated: The php log file from the system partition is writing logs constantly which causes the disk space to fill up slowly.
file: /usr/local/logs/php-fpm.log

Next Steps Updated: The file was cleared today and the disk space is looking good.
I will have to check with server team if we can disable the logging for this file.
